reviewText: This is one of the best Christmas movies that I have ever seen. I just wish with all my heart that there was a soundtrack available.It has some beautiful songs. The one in the coffee shop on the jukebox, the songs at the dance and the beautiful song at the end.
summary: great, wish there was a soundtrack
Title: A Holiday Romance

reviewText: Also is sold on DVD under the title, " A Holiday Romance".Have enjoyed this film over the years during the holiday season.  It seems to be just as touching, sweet and enjoyable each time.  The actors are all very good, as is the story.  It captures the message of the season, love and caring for family, friends and community.  Naomi Judd's Lilly Waite is just the kind of teacher you would want to have had, or would want for your child.  The often under-rated Gerald McRaney is perfect, as are the entire cast.  The small town setting of Bethleheim will make you dream of leaving the suburbs, or city.  A perfect 'let's get cozy with a cup of cocoa' holiday movie for the whole family.  Also, if you are a teacher, this one of those uplifting films about good teachers.
Title: A Holiday Romance

reviewText: This is a must see movie!!This movie is centered around a school that is in financial trouble so it is being observed to see what programs could be cut out in order to save the school. It was decided to cut the music program but everyone loved the teacher and what she has done for the community through her teaching music and tutoring. She has a way of reaching the kids that no one else can reach. Her last thing to do was to put on the school Christmas Pageant. The community pulled together to donate money and keep her and the music program running.This was a great family movie to watch and I highly recommend it to anyone. A good wholesome movie that dont have a lot of other junk added to it.
Title: A Holiday Romance

reviewText: I selected this movie because of setting and Naomi Judd and Andy Griffith.  This was a sweet wonderful story and I enjoyed it very much. I  highly recommend this movie.
Title: A Holiday Romance

reviewText: Yes, if you're looking for a feel-good movie, you should definitely get this one.  Darrah Cloud knows how to put together a story with bang-up endings, and this movie with its two story threads has two great endings, back-to-back.But there is some bad news.  Naomi Judd (unless of course you're a fan of hers) is not much of an actress here.  Her scenes look more like a personal appearance, with lines.The daughter is cute and believable.  The uncle is also credible.The love story is totally botched.  The pacing is disjointed.  And there is a lack of motivation.  It is simply not credible, so don't expect to be touched by it.Andy is Andy, and he adds a touch a quality that makes the others look more amateurish than they otherwise would.The rock music (and the absence of Christmas music) was a bit grating.  It was sad that the school kids couldn't relate to any Christmas carols.  They had to have rock.  The raw, harsh tone of the girl singing what were supposed to be Christmas songs was a dischordant note for me.  Others might not be bothered.Still, I say don't miss it.  There aren't that many that you can afford to pass it up.  Darrah Cloud's "A Holiday for Love" is a much better movie, so if you're only getting one, get that one instead.
Title: A Holiday Romance

reviewText: What a breeze of fresh air, this movie is. I was deeply touched by the characters and quality of acting when I first saw it on hallmark channel a couple of years ago. I just had to have my own copy.....and really love not enduring the commercials too. The special song in this film is a must hear, if you have not. For me, the entire movie is eye candy as well, the homes lit with Christmas decorations are something I seldom see anymore, as I live remote rural; my own decorating has become quite humble and rustic. I often stop and play scenes over and over......then I put it away until my memory of it calls again. This is a keeper to pass on to generations. An enchanting romantic drama.
summary: maybe my all time favorite movie for ALL seasons

reviewText: This Christmas movie is a great family show. A teen who has moved from town to town, just like her uncle did as he was growing up... He is a hatch-man for the school board, and like most needs to cut the Music Program to make ends meet. Schools should go a long way to keep Music Programs in place. The reunion of the B-17 crew was predictable, but heart-warming. Andy Griffith, Naomi Judd, Gerald Rainey... What a great cast!

reviewText: A SONG FOR THE SEASON IS  A MOVIE FROM THE HEART. THE MOVIE SHOWS WHAT AN IMPACT A CARING, LOVING, TEACHER CAN HAVE ON YOUNG STUDENTS. HOW A TEACHER CAN TAKE A SHY BUT GIFTED CHILD AND BRING OUT THE BEST OF THAT CHILD FOR ALL TO SEE. IF YOU EVER HAD A TEACHER WHO TOOK THE TIME AND EFFORT TO BRING OUT THE BEST IN YOU THEN YOU KNOW WHAT I AM TALKING ABOUT. IT TAKES PLACE AROUND CHRISTMAS TIME BUT IT COULD HAPPEN AT ANY TIME DURING THE YEAR. I KNOW THAT WE ALL LIKE TO SEE 'ITS A WONDERFUL LIFE' AT THIS TIME OF THE YEAR BUT MAKE A CHANGE THIS YEAR AND WATCH 'A SONG FOR THE SEASON' YOU WILL BE GLAD THAT YOU DID. THANKS A LOT FOR TAKING THE TIME TO READ THIS REVIEW.

reviewText: We love Christmas movies but I'm not sure what everyone is loving about this. We were disappointed... Andy Griffith + Christmas should = GREAT, but this turned out to be a low budget made for TV snooze fest. We love Andy Griffith and were hoping to add to our annual Christmas viewing list of must watches but we won't be watching this one again. Andy was the main reason we bought this plus the fact that Netflix does not carry it plus it had so many raving reviews and high ratings here on Amazon. Turns out this is boring lame story w/ lousy acting. While it did have a couple of okay moments, this movie could have been so much better. It is hard to pin point. Maybe it was the uninteresting story or the bad script or the reality that Naoimi Judd is not a very good actress or all the little things like the fact that trees in Kentucky don't have leaves in December nor do you drive a convertible in December in Kentucky, just to name a few. My wife kept looking at me while we watched this saying "this is really cheesy" and "why did you buy this"???Andy Griffith fans may want to pass on this one and know that he isn't even the main character. The main actors are Naomi "Dudd" and some little angry troubled brat(whose singing voice is not so good). Do buy this if you are a Naomi fan. For everyone else, my advice, save your and money wait for this to come to Netflix(and the drink a lot of coffee; otherwise, you may fall asleep...). My 3 stars rating is being kind. My wife would say 2 or 1.If you want your Andy Griffith Christmas fix, watch the wonderful "The Christmas Story" from the 1st season of The Andy Griffith Show - episode 11. Try the DVD, TV Sets: Holiday Treats
Title: A Holiday Romance

reviewText: This is a very heart-warming film with three very good actors portraying the main characters.  I highly recommend it as a film the whole family can enjoy.  Performances by Naomi Judd, Andy Griffith, and Gerald McRaney were excellent...very good casting.  Fern, played by Alison Pill, is a typical teenager with attitude.  But as the movie unfolds she becomes more open and accepting, as a result of her friendship with her music teacher, played by Naomi Judd.

reviewText: This was more than I expected it to be.  It is a story about a small town and of friendship,  family,  love, and the true meaning of what Christmas is all about.  Be sure to have a box of tissues near by when you watch this.  The acting is wonderful.  The music is  wonderful.  The sparks that come from Naomi Judd and Gerald McRaney is so great and of course the wonderful Andy Griffith. This is a movie that the whole family should sit down and watch together.

reviewText: This Christmas movie is so very good with Gerald McRaney, Andy Griffith and Naomi Judd.  If you are a person who enjoys the holiday movies then you will love this one.It's a movie in which warms your heart and makes you think about life in general.  This movie puts the idea of drinking hot chocolate and wrapping in a blanket while watching.  It's a very homey movie which is what many people enjoy seeing over the holidays.If you enjoy movies in which can be "related" to home life in so many families then this is one you should watch.  I must tell you the cover of this movie and the music is what made me take notice of this movie.  It shows exactly what I look for in a movie:  Snow, a light burning distance and a beautiful lady in a red coat and black hat looking toward the heavens.  I did buy this movie on the little I read but mostly on the beautiful cover.  I looked at this movie for two years before finally purchasing the movie and I am so very glad i did!  The actors and actress are well known so the movie had to be super!

reviewText: I collect my favorite holiday movies and Hallmark every year provides a new round from which to choose.  I had never seen this movie before buying the DVD. This was a great movie about a school that must make cuts in order to survive and, of course, the first things to be cut are ??  (I'll leave the mystery)...  The love story is poignant and sweet and the ending will bring a tear to your sensitive eye.Highly recommend if you like holiday love stories...

reviewText: What a cast and a really lovely story.  The standouts here are, of course, Gerald McRaney, Naomi Judd (oh, that voice), Alison Pill (who knew she could sing as well as act?), and Andy Griffith in a hilarious turn as a crusty, set-in-his-ways father and grandfather who does his level best to drive everyone crazy.  Still, it's a great family film with enough laughs and drama along the way to drive the story and I dare anyone with a heart not to tear up in the end when Naomi and Allison team up for that final duet.  Enjoy!
Title: A Holiday Romance

reviewText: I purchased this as a gift for my sister-in-law who is pretty picky on what she watches. The seller stated it also went under the title "A Song for the Season" which meant nothing to me since I thought I was purchasing the "A Holiday Season" pictured in the listing. It came as a surprise when I received "A Song for the Season" with a different box cover than the one shown. I shipped it off anyway as a gift and it took 3 viewings before my S-I-L agreed it was the same movie and stopped complaining that I sent her the wrong one. If you think you're getting what's pictured you may be wrong and I wasn't about to pay to return yet another item listed incorrectly or even go through the return process. There should be some way for a seller to advise you if you're not going to get what's pictured... even though the contents may be the same movie. It could go under 12 different titles but when you see the pic on Amazon that's the cover you expect to receive.I also didn't realize the seller would start spamming me with their movie listings nor that there would be religious messages on the back of the cover. Some sellers offer a "sanitized" version of movies to meet their standard of acceptance but I really didn't appreciate that not being noted in the seller's comments either. I gave the seller a poor rating but the movie would have been 5 stars had it arrived with the box cover shown and absent the religious messages.
summary: You may not get what you see
Title: A Holiday Romance

reviewText: Great Christmas movie, Great romance and story, Acting was not the greatest but will watch over many times again.
